botanical_details.genus: Solanum can be annuals, perennials, evergreen or deciduous shrubs or twining climbers, with simple or pinnnately lobed leaves and star- or bowl-shaped, 5-lobed flowers with prominent stamens, followed by fleshy fruits

how_to_grow.cultivation: Grow in an open, frost-free site in deep, fertile, moisture-retentive soil. Improve soil with organic matter such as well-rooted manure in the autumn. Earth-up plants as they grow to protect from frost and prevent developing tubers from being exposed to light. Water well in dry periods. See Grow-Your-Own Potatoes for further information
how_to_grow.propagation: Grow from tubers known as 'seed potatoes' sprouted or 'chitted' prior to planting
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to slugs, cutworms, wireworms, leaf and bud eelworm and potato cyst eelworm
how_to_grow.diseases: May be susceptible to potato blight, potato scab, potato tuber rots, potato blackleg and stem canker
